attributes.action: A legal aid framework for victims in the case of IVP dataset compromises.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill requires the creation of huge datasets of citizens online activity. These datasets will be a very tempting target for criminals. The Government should create a legal aid framework that will help any victims in the case of these datasets being compromised.
attributes.additional_details: We realise that as much attention to security will be given as possible in terms of protecting the hardware and the software protecting this data. This does not mean however that a compromise is not possible and attention needs to be given to what will happen in the event of a compromise and what aid can be given to victims. The framework for this aid should be discussed and a framework formalised in advance so that it is clear to each citizen what help and redress they may seek.

attributes.action: Tax all products containing palm oil
attributes.background: The production of palm oil is a dangerous and environmentaly disastrous procedure. It produces vast quantities of CO2 as well as damaging local ecosystems and the worldwide environment. Place a tax on all products in the UK to reduce its sales.

attributes.action: Debate whether self-regulation of the press is adequate.
attributes.background: The UK press is constantly coming under fire for misrepresenting stories and misleading the public with inflammatory opinion pieces that purport to be news items.
attributes.additional_details:
“the press is given significant and special rights in this country ... With these rights, however, come responsibilities to the public interest: to respect the truth, to obey the law and to uphold the rights and liberties of individuals. In short, to honour the very principles proclaimed and articulated by the industry itself (and to a large degree reflected in the Editors’ Code of Practice)”.
- Sir Brian Leveson

Some newspapers are clearly failing to 'respect the truth'.

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: Build new runways at Heathrow and Gatwick to future proof UK airport capacity
attributes.background: Heathrow often runs at 98% capcity, and is the busiest two runway airport in the world.  Likewise Gatwick is the busiest single runway airport in the world.  The capacity is long overdue, and planes are circling both hubs emitting more CO2 than necessary. Build both runways as soon as possible.
attributes.additional_details:
Gatwick has the world's busiest single-use runway. It does have two runways on site but the close proximity of the two and the length and lack of guidance for the second means that only one is used. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World%27s_busiest_airport#Busiest_airports
The plan to expand Heathrow was supported by businesses, the aviation industry, the British Chambers of Commerce, the Confederation of British Industry, the Trades Union Congress and the then Labour government. 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heathrow_Airport
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-37566361

attributes.action: Require all dogs to be on leads in public places
attributes.background: In public places, such as fields used for football or other things, dogs cause havoc by roaming free and urinating wherever they please whilst their owners turn a blind eye or claim that the dog won't hurt anyone. Sufficient excercise can be gained by walking with them on a lead

attributes.action: Provide girls and ladies from low income families free sanitary protection
attributes.background: An article was published in The Guardian stating that girls from poor backgrounds are struggling to afford sanitary protection. Some are using makeshift protection and others missing school due to the issue. All girls and ladies in the UK need to have access to suitable sanitary protection.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/mar/17/girls-from-poorer-families-in-england-struggle-to-afford-sanitary-protection

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/mar/18/child-poverty-teachers-schools-sanitary-towels-low-income-families?CMP=fb_gu

attributes.action: No Trump UK state visit until apology issued on false wiretapping allegation.
attributes.background: Trump allegations against GCHQ remain unsubstantiated. UK Foreign Secretary should press for a full public apology from Trump.

attributes.action: Introduce animal rights to the primary curriculum
attributes.background: All children need to be educated about sentient beings and how non human animals are capable of having the same senses as us. Every one feels pain,including all non human animals. Everyone feels love,pleasure,joy,loss,fear frustration and depression,including non human animals.
attributes.additional_details: To deny someone of their basic rights of freedom and life is morally wrong. To take away a life for reasons of greed and pleasure, for reasons of gain/profit is morally wrong. We have a moral obligation to teach children that killing all forms of sentient animals is wrong. Children need to have the choices of not wanting to eat,wear,or exploit those who rely on us for protection and defence. Children need to be taught all about the profit making industries who exploit and kill non human animals.

attributes.action: Make it a specific criminal offence for attacking staff within the hospitals
attributes.background: The NHS staff and the employees of the NHS partner companies are often threatened and attacked within the hospitals by visitors or the patients themselves. I would like to start this petition as stronger measures should be taken against it by the authorities and be made a specific criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: Apart from the NHS staff, the cleaners, car park attendants and security officers are also often attacked by the members of public, patients and the relatives of the patients. The NHS contractors also contribute towards the well-being of the patients as they also have duty of care but if they are attacked, the prosecution is usually very week and the offenders get away with it and can do it again, so in light of this, we urge you to take tougher actions and make it a specific criminal offence.

attributes.action: Change the law on sexual abuse in a position of trust to include sports clubs
attributes.background: I was concerned to find that the Sexual Offences Act 2003 doesn't include sports clubs as one of the settings in which the Act’s provisions on ‘abuse of position of trust’ apply. At the moment, the law doesn't protect 16 and 17 year olds from sexual harassment and abuse in sports clubs.

attributes.action: Introduce 100% Inheritance Tax At £10 Million
attributes.background: Don’t you wish to see the gap between the ultra-rich and the poor begin to narrow, instead of constantly widening? How can we even begin creating an even playing field where equal opportunity exists for everyone, while the colossal gap between privilege and poverty stares us in the face every day?
attributes.additional_details:
If no-one could pass on more than £10 million total to be divided between their heirs, we would see the gap between the rich and poor begin to narrow for the first time. 

A New Graded System could look like this :
40% IT payable after £750,000
50% IT payable after £1 million
60% IT payable after £2. 5 million
70% IT payable after £5 million
85% IT payable after £7. 5 million
100% IT payable after £10 million

100% IT could help properly fund the NHS, Education, Housing, Etc…  Please support it!

attributes.action: Outlaw anti-abortion campaigns near health centres
attributes.background:
Blown-up, graphic images of abortion, and threats to film people attending BPAS surgeries are likely to scare vulnerable people away from the one place they could get state-sanctioned, impartial advice and assistance.

People have a right to express their views but not in a way that harms others.
attributes.additional_details:
It is well-documented that providing safe, non-judgemental access to health and family planning advice leads to an overall decrease in sexual-health related problems. Aggressive campaigning denies that access. 

Victims of abuse or rape, those who are unsure how to cope with pregnancy, contraceptives or sexual health issues might go away in fear then fail to seek help at all -  disastrous for the victims, and likely to create long-lasting problems for their families and social care services.

attributes.action: Make it a specific offence to cause distress or hatred to rough sleepers.
attributes.background: A student from one of the world's top universities (the University of Cambridge) has been caught on camera setting fire to a £20 note in front of a freezing homeless person. This sort of behavoiur is unacceptable in a civilized society and should be dealt with swiftly by the police.
attributes.additional_details: It has been rumoured that burning a £50 note in front of a homeless person is one of the initiation ceremonies of Oxford's notorious Bullingdon club.

attributes.action: Create CPOs for all derelict properties to house veterans.
attributes.background: We want more Social Housing in the UK. Priority given to those who fought for our freedom. They are, some of them, suffering from PTSD and not so far from danger.
attributes.additional_details: We also want to make sales of MoD land for development conditional on providing housing for ex military personnel.

attributes.action: Regulate locksmithing in the UK
attributes.background: In the UK any one can trade as a locksmith. This means that the person you get to secure your property may not know the standards that are associated with the industry. It is time that this crucial trade is regulated to stop scam locksmiths from operating.
attributes.additional_details: At this time there are several trade associations operating in the UK.  We need to be clear on one operating body that can regulate, vet and ensure that those who trade in this sector are of a minimum standard. This would help to eliminate poor standards of craftsmanship and ensure better security throughout the Uk

attributes.action: Give more funding into the research of mental health especially anxiety.
attributes.background: People go undiagnosed or even wrongly diagnosed with anxiety and depression every day in the UK. We need more funding into the research and better treatments. I would also like potential financial support for those with anxiety who cannot work.

attributes.action: Change the age to 25 for the sale of Fireworks
attributes.background: If the law was to change to make it illegal to sell to anyone under 25, I'm confident the constant noise on non celebrating days (Fireworks nt, Diwali & New Year's Eve) would dwindle away. Fireworks started 22/10 until 10/12 & back again 24/12 in Dagenham. They're a nuisance especially to Pets.
attributes.additional_details:
How many reports have we seen this year alone about children being injured by other children launching fireworks at them? As usual to many.
Why are supermarkets allowed to advertise "sales" on Fireworks from 7/11/16? 
In this day & age why can't fireworks be made to make minimal noise?

attributes.action: Government to Reconsider A Legal, Regulated Market for Medical Cannabis.
attributes.background: Government to reconsider A legal, regulated market for the consumption, sale and production of Medical Cannabis in the wake of the recent decision to legalise in a further 4 US states in November 2016. Taking into account evidence gathered by the Cross Party Group and Germany's decision to regulate.

attributes.action: Make student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background:
Making student loan repayments after tax increases the cost of the debt to the student by around 30%.

Make student loan repayments tax deductible to improve the affordability of higher education.

attributes.action: NHS - Give more support to Young Adults
attributes.background: It is extremely worrying & stressful for anyone going to hospital, it is even worse for any young adult (aged 16-20) as whenever you go to clinic, operation or getting a referral done it is extremely difficult, as no one knows where to put you as technically you are too old for children's, but...
attributes.additional_details: ... but are also too young to be in the adults. This is worse when you become an inpatient and they don't know which ward to put you on, and neither is ideal. You spend long periods of uncertainty being passed from departments and you are just waiting for someone to give you the help & support you desperately need. This is a petition for the NHS to give more support and structure within the NHS for Young Adults, (one way do to this would be to introduce specific young adult clinics and wards)

attributes.action: Make physical appearance a protected characteristic.
attributes.background: People feel victimised by an unjust decision to restrict their identity. Having their own hair style and colour makes people feel more comfortable in society, this can make people feel more comfortable with themselves. This should be accepted to give everyone an equal opportunity to be themselves.
attributes.additional_details: In schools, teachers try to dictate hair colour and style. Article 10 of the Human Rights Act states that students should be able to express themselves and make them feel identified without the interference from the authority (teachers being the authority in schools). Also, the same idea applies in article 14. This article was created to try and allow everyone to have equal opportunities for something they may otherwise be judged upon. So why doesn't Article 14 protect physical appearance? All other protected characteristics are things that make people feel more accepted in society because in the past they were not as widely accepted. People should not change the way they look from a style that makes them feel comfortable with themselves, so don't make them.

attributes.action: Legislate against inclusion of food colourings in children's medicine.
attributes.background: Medicines have different regulations from food and drink, the complete ban on colourings, flavourings, sweeteners and preservatives in food and drink for young children  does not apply to medicines. drugs like antibiotics & pain relief still contain these artificial colourings.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.actiononadditives.org/s/Press-Release.docx

attributes.action: Give volunteers similar equality rights as employee's.
attributes.background: As a volunteer in the United Kingdom, an organisation is allowed to dismiss you without giving a reason or even on grounds of discrimination. Volunteers are the backbone of many communities in this country and I believe they should have the same rights as employee's not to be discriminated against.
attributes.additional_details:
As an employee, you have the right not to be discriminated against. If a company dismisses you and you believe they have discriminated in making this decision, you have the right to appeal to an employment tribunal.

As it stands, a volunteer could put in 30 years and if something changes with their circumstances, the organisation can dismiss them. I believe they should be able to appeal this decision to a similar tribunal and volunteering should be covered by all discrimination law.

attributes.action: Term Time Job Contracts for Parents
attributes.background: Term time jobs will allow thousands of parents to work and be at home with their children during school holidays. This should be accessible for parents with children aged 5-16
attributes.additional_details: Enforcing companies to employ a ratio of term time contracts dependant on staff numbers will allow parents to return to work and still take care of their children. This will get many people off of benefits and back into work. Many lone parents such as myself want to work but also want to be at home while our children are young to raise them and spend quality time with them. Students could be placed on temporary contracts during school holidays to fill the term time contractors.

attributes.action: Employers to have mandatory training on hearing impairment & its implications
attributes.background: Most people assume people hearing impaired from birth are fine when they have a hearing aid/s. A hearing aid does not improve someones ability when it comes to processing information. I believe that specific training would be useful to employers in explaining the cognitive process that is required.
attributes.additional_details: Employers don't seem to fully understand the difficulties that people born hearing impaired have when it comes to processing information. Some comments I have received have shown naivety bordering on ignorance. It shocks me how uneducated employers seem to be on a impairment which affects more than 11 million people in the UK. That's one in six of the population. By 2035, it is estimated there will be 15.6 million people with hearing loss in the UK. That's one in five.

attributes.action: Launch an independent inquiry into politician behaviour in the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The EU referendum campaign was beset by lies and misinformation.

We propose to launch an independent inquiry into the behaviour of MPs and MEPs, to hold to account those willing to further their own aims, irrespective of the truth.

attributes.action: Build a relief road for Dove Holes, Derbyshire.
attributes.background: The village is not a suitable route for the high volume of large goods vehicles and commuter traffic that pass through daily. This is a major through route through a residential area that desperately needs a bypass or relief road, both for the Villagers and the road users.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum asking if we want to leave the single market.
attributes.background: On 17th Jan 2017 Theresa May announced the government decision to take the UK out of the single market. As during the previous referendum it was not clear whether voting leave would trigger a single market exit, allow people to have their say in light of this new information.
attributes.additional_details: NB this does not mean a re-run of the original referendum. The new referendum would instead determine whether the majority of the British people would prefer a 'soft' Brexit, with continued access to the single market but no controls on EU immigration and continuing EU fees/directives, or a 'hard' Brexit, with controls on immigration, full sovereignty and no EU fees, but no access to the single market.

attributes.action: Cost to be cut in family courts.
attributes.background: During court processing through the family court over residency of child/ren between an applicant father and the respondent mother. If Cafcass orders a section 7 report and these findings prove the mother has abused her child/ren, cost should be cut for the fathers, to help protect their children.
attributes.additional_details: To many fathers these days have to apply to the family court to either receive some sort of access to their children, or in worse cases to try protect their children from abuse from the mothers. If mothers are found to be abusing their children in anyway and the fathers are to be awarded full residency of the child/ren then they should receive some sort of legal aid or cut the cost of the fees. It's wrong that anyone should have to pay thousands of pounds to save or protect a child/ren

attributes.action: Legal minimum age to enter into marriage in UK to change from 16 to 18 years.
attributes.background:
Legal minimum age to enter into a marriage in England and Wales is 16 years, although this requires parental consent if a participant is under 18 years.
Changing the law to 18 years will have a huge positive impact on arranged or forced marriages here in England and Wales as some are forced at 16.
attributes.additional_details: When a child turns 18 they are expected to start making their own decisions and be treated like adults. They are obliged to take responsibility for their own lives, so why is the legal age of marriage in England and Wales 16 when they are still considered children? This is common in Asian communities where young 16 years old's are expected to marry and take on responsibility they are not ready for.  Does a 16 year old understand what marriage is at that age? Are they ready for this commitment?

attributes.action: Ask retailers to not automatically issue receipts but instead give us an option.
attributes.background:
It is estimated that 12 BILLION receipts are issued in the UK alone each year and most end up in the bin.
By opting to not have your receipt you could help save Rainforests from deforestation, reduce waste, reduce oil and water consumption and help conserve this planet. Retailers also reduce costs.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no requirement under the sale and supply of goods act 1994 act to supply a receipt to prove that a contract exists between buyer and seller, nor is there any requirement to provide physical evidence of any kind, except for the faulty goods/purchase. 

Retailers would also save thousands of pounds in reduced costs.

attributes.action: England : have a referendum to leave the U.k. thus leaving the EU automatically
attributes.background:
As the UK is a political entity within the EU. If England would vote to leave the U.K. Then England would automatically become its own country outside the UK and the EU. No article 50 needed. No negotiations beforehand. 

The Scottish referendum made this clear to any country that leaves the U.K.

attributes.action: Every Knife sold through Retailers in the UK have tamper proof serial numbers.
attributes.background: Make our UK Streets safer for people and today's Youth. Every Retail purchase made by a person must produce ID , proof of address (much like a television for licensing purposes).This may significantly help police to save time and money and also to identify the perpetrator(s) leading to a conviction

attributes.action: Stop the government proposing any changes to IR35 regime in the private sector
attributes.background: After Philip Hammond's catastrophic U-turn with the proposed  increase in National Insurance. It's my belief that this government is unaware of the significant negative impact it would have by trying to apply  the public sector’s new IR35 framework onto the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/170118

http://www.f9consulting.co.uk/crisis-for-public-sector-contractors/

http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/smallbusiness/article-3761454/Tax-ruling-contractors-leave-public-sector-work.html

https://www.cchdaily.co.uk/planned-public-sector-ir35-reforms-could-see-ps115m-tax-loss

https://www.ipse.co.uk/news/ir35-proposal-how-will-you-get-paid-april-2017

attributes.action: Stop women who have a third child as a result of rape to have to declare it.
attributes.background:
Guardian 16.3.17 proposal to ask new mothers who have been raped for verification if they wish to claim tax credits for more than two children has become law without any debate/vote in parliament.

The so-called rape clause, was added to legislation late on Wed as an amendment to an existing act.
attributes.additional_details:
controversial proposal to ask new mothers who have been raped for verification if they wish to claim tax credits for more than two children has become law without any debate or vote in parliament.

The so-called rape clause, which will be applied as part of new restrictions on tax credit entitlement, was added to legislation late on Wednesday as an amendment to an existing act. The plans will come into effect within a month. It will.mean someone may need to relive sexual assault.

attributes.action: Declare June 24th to be an annual UK wide bank holiday.
attributes.background: We the people politely ask HM Government to declare June 24th a UK wide annual bank holiday in recognition of our historic vote to regain our national sovereignty and independence from the European Union.

attributes.action: Prevent the Child maintenance service from showing salaries to ex partners
attributes.background: Currently the CMS show the calculation used to work out my maintenance payment this calculation includes my weekly salary details.  CMS get their figures from the HMRC so there should be no need to declare my salary to my ex partner, surely this is data protection

attributes.action: Allow the public to "vote out" members of the house of Lords.
attributes.background: The membership of the House of Lords needs to be reduced in size. A directly elected House of Lords would vie with the House of Commons as being representative of the people and has been rejected by the government. As a compromise the electorate should be allowed to choose which peers are sacked.

attributes.action: Remove the ban on disabled refugees.
attributes.background: It has just been revealed that the government has been refusing to consider applications from individuals with disabilities fleeing war-torn countries since January. Shutting the most desperate, vulnerable people out is an affront to British values and applications must be reconsidered immediately.

attributes.action: The UK should start a UN resolution to stop human right's violations in Myanmar
attributes.background: Myanmar security forces are violating the human right's of the Rohingya. Survivor accounts include crop destruction, rape, beatings and murder including children. The UK should use the security council seat to initiate a UN resolution to stop the crimes and give the UN full access or face sanctions.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the UN OHCHR Flash Report:

http://www.ohchr.org/Documents/Countries/MM/FlashReport3Feb2017.pdf

attributes.action: Make Ofsted assess children's mental health when assessing schools.
attributes.background: I believe that mental health should be taken into account by Ofsted. Ofsted should report on the mental health of the pupils in schools they inspect.
attributes.additional_details: I was personally an A* student in nearly every subject, but I had mental health problems. I was told that this is not factored into any student when assessing a child. We need change!

attributes.action: Pay student nurses a wage whilst on placement during their nursing degree
attributes.background: Student nurses are expected to work full time (37.5 hours a week) with no income to show for their hard work. Due to working full time, they are then limited to finding paid work outside of placement time. On top of this, they are also having to study for a degree like all other full time students.

attributes.action: Petitions with 1M+ signatures to be guaranteed a full, early debate.
attributes.background:
Currently, the Government may choose to schedule debates for popular petitions achieving more than 100,000 signatures but is not obliged to do so.

I suggest that a new threshold, of 1Million signatures, should guarantee that the subject of the petition is debated, and debated without delay.

attributes.action: Make euthanasia legal in the UK in cases of Terminal illnesses & suffering
attributes.background: I've got end stage liver disease. Knowing the death I was facing I've  tried to euthanise myself lots in the last 2 years, almost successful, but sadly not. I'm now using up a bed at a Mental health rehab unit cos they have to protect me from myself, even though it's not a MH issue, & suffering
attributes.additional_details: If an animal was suffering with the pain & symptoms I, and many others are going through daily, keeping the animal alive would result in prosecution for cruelty. We allow animals dignity in dying, so why do we not offer this option, with extremely stringent procedures in place to protect the vulnerable, to fellow humans? I wanted to just fall asleep, instead I'm being forced to suffer Hepatic Encephalopathy & extreme pain, both of which are extremely distressing. Please help change the law!

attributes.action: Test all children for food intolerances in primary school
attributes.background: Thousands of children are going into adulthood suffering from undiagnosed food intolerances which lead to serious auto immune diseases. With a simple finger prick blood test, we can keep them healthy and save pain, suffering and money all round.
attributes.additional_details: Auto immune diseases such as IBS, Crohns Disease, Arthritis Fibromyalgia and Celiac Disease can be caused by years of undiagnosed food intolerances, Children can also suffer permanent damage due to constant infections the body can't fight as the immune system is always on high alert against what it sees as poison. A simple test and diet change can save our children from a lifetime of pain and save the NHS an enormous amount of money

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and invest billions saved into the NHS.
attributes.background: Average income for pensioners is now higher than for workers. The Work and Pensions Committee says the 'triple lock' (which cost an extra £6bn in 2015) is "unsustainable" and "more intergenerationally unfair" on younger families.
attributes.additional_details:
By targeting pensioner welfare at only those who need it we can save billions to fund our NHS.

1) The 'triple lock' guarantees that the state pension rises each year by the highest of either inflation, average earnings, or 2.5%.
2) The 'triple lock' cost an extra £6 billion in 2015 - Government Actuary's Department.
3) The average pensioner has a higher income than the average worker, after housing costs and dependants had been taken into account  - IFS, 2015.
4) The Work and Pensions Committee called the 'triple lock' "unsustainable" and "unfair" on younger families - November 2016.

attributes.action: Make it a law for both parents to pay equal childcare costs.
attributes.background: This petition is designed to address the re-balance required to right the injustice of one parent dis-proportionally bearing the costs of childcare in situations where parents are separated. These costs are usually excluded from maintenance agreements and unfairly burden one parent financially.
attributes.additional_details: Where parents are separated, but both work, why is it that only one of those parents has to carry the cost for childcare? The child is both parents responsibility, both parents are at work so not available to look after that child, but only one parent pays? Maintenance agreements only calculate for a child's living expenses however childcare cost are excluded but a necessity in today's society. In many ways this could be seen as a hindrance for those parents who wish to return to work.

attributes.action: Debate cost of Buckingham Palace refurbishment while NHS is in a critical state.
attributes.background: I work in the NHS. My role requires me to work at very many different trusts so I have a good overall picture of the state of affairs of the NHS. It is a very bad picture with a gloomy forecast. People are dying and more will die due to a lack of progressive strategic planning for the last 4 govts.

attributes.action: Make England have BST during winter and  BST + 1 hour during the summer.
attributes.background:
The advantages include:
-increased daylight during the afternoon.
-energy saving from lighting being delayed, producing reduced carbon emissions;
-reduced roads accidents
-health benefit from afternoon sunlight and outdoor exercise
- benefit the tourist trade
- no cost to UK exchequer
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Society for the Prevention of accidents is in favour of GMT + 1 hour in the winter and GMT + 2 hours in the summer as more people are killed on the road as a result of the earlier afternoon darkness in the winter caused by our current winter time of GMT.
